intro: Craterispermum montanum, commonly known as the mountain craterispermum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and high-altitude environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, arranged in a cluster, and it produces a distinctive seed structure known as a pappus. Craterispermum montanum is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
